question: [File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/state_merkle_pruner/state_merkle_pruner_manager.rs] [Function: get_min_readable_version()] [Timing side channel] Does the SeqCst load at line 63 have consistent timing regardless of the value? Can timing variations leak information about min_readable_version to observers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/state_merkle_pruner/state_merkle_pruner_manager.rs] [Function: is_pruning_pending()] [State disclosure] At lines 86-90, this reveals whether pruning is currently active. Can this information be used by attackers to time attacks when the system is under pruning load? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/state_merkle_pruner/state_merkle_pruner_manager.rs] [Function: get_prune_window()] [Configuration disclosure] At line 58-60, prune_window is returned publicly. Can attackers use this to calculate exactly when historical state will be pruned and time attacks accordingly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/state_merkle_pruner/state_merkle_pruner_manager.rs] [Function: is_pruner_enabled()] [Capability disclosure] At line 54-56, this reveals whether pruning is enabled. Can attackers use this to identify validators with pruning disabled and target them for resource exhaustion attacks? (Low)
